'Howard Martin Temin' (December 10, 1934 – February 9, 1994) was a U.S.
geneticist. Along with Renato Dulbecco and David Baltimore he discovered
reverse transcriptase in the 1970s at the
University of WisconsinâMadison, for which he shared the 1975 Nobel Prize in
Physiology or Medicine.
categories: Nobel laureates in Physiology or Medicine
Foreign Members of the Royal Society
Recipients of the Albert Lasker Award for Basic Medical Research
